isomorphic_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns are functional structures that repeat with identical causal topology across different scales, from subatomic to cosmic, allowing direct comparison and pattern detection based on observable mechanisms.
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete and observable.
Validate for complete coverage; flag gaps as incomplete.
Support sub-categories for compound patterns to maintain cleanliness.
Export as lean JSON for use in other modules; no external references.
Apply evaluation methods to validate patterns; use contradictions_ledger to track inconsistencies.

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Iterate through each category and sub-category; check that all required scales have non-empty string mappings; flag incomplete entries.

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: For each category, verify logical alignment between mappings and principle; flag misalignments or forced fits.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Represent causal topology of each mapping as a graph; compute similarity scores (e.g., via graph edit distance) between graphs across scales; score >0.8 indicates strong isomorphism.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Identify scales with weak or absent mappings; log for refinement in contradictions_ledger.

evaluation_methods.name: Contradiction Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Scan for inconsistencies (e.g., mappings contradicting principle); catalog in ledger with source, conflict, justification, scope, and branches.

evaluation_methods.name: Fixed Point Check
evaluation_methods.description: Recursively apply evaluation methods to the module's output until no changes occur, confirming stability.

isomorphic_mapping.definition: A comprehensive set of structural, functional, and conceptual analogies between biological brains (human/neural systems) and artificial neural networks (ANNs/deep learning models), derived from extensive research papers and sites. These mappings highlight similarities in architecture, learning, processing, and dynamics, while noting limitations for coherence. Sources include arXiv, Nature, PubMed, PMC, Wikipedia, and others (e.g., arXiv:2306.04449, Nature s41598-021-84813-6, PMC articles on neuromorphic computing).
handling_rules: Mappings are based on observable mechanisms and research findings; focus on direct analogies without overclaiming identity.
Each category includes biological description, artificial counterpart, key similarity, and supporting sources/examples.
Aim for maximal coverage: 30+ categories compiled from searches.
Coherence maintained by grouping into themes (e.g., structure, learning, dynamics); analogies are bidirectional where applicable.

human-ai_categories.biological: Neuron with dendrites (input receivers), soma (integration), axon (output transmitter). Fires action potentials based on threshold.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Artificial neuron/perceptron with inputs, summation function, activation (e.g., sigmoid/ReLU), and output.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both integrate weighted inputs and apply a non-linear threshold to produce output signals.
human-ai_categories.sources: Wikipedia (Artificial neuron); Medium (Saurabh Mhatre); arXiv:2306.04449; arXiv:2511.04455v1

human-ai_categories.biological: Synapses as junctions between neurons, with neurotransmitters modulating strength.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Weights/connections between nodes, adjustable during training.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both represent adjustable strengths of influence between units, enabling information flow.

human-ai_categories.biological: Hebbian learning: 'Cells that fire together wire together'; long-term potentiation (LTP) strengthens connections.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Backpropagation and gradient descent adjust weights based on error signals.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both mechanisms allow adaptation by strengthening or weakening connections over time/experience.
human-ai_categories.sources: PubMed:24244138; PLoS Comput Biol (2013); arXiv:2303.07273; PMC: PMC11751442

human-ai_categories.biological: Homeostatic mechanisms maintain firing rate stability (e.g., fast rate detectors).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Regularization techniques (e.g., L2 norm) prevent overfitting and stabilize training.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both ensure network stability during learning to avoid runaway excitation or silence.
human-ai_categories.sources: PLoS Comput Biol e1003330; Frontiers in Neural Circuits (2020); Nature s41598-025-09114-8

human-ai_categories.biological: Layered cortex: Early visual areas detect edges, higher areas recognize objects.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Deep layers: Convolutional layers extract features hierarchically (edges to objects).
human-ai_categories.similarity: Progressive abstraction from simple to complex representations.
human-ai_categories.sources: Nature s41562-025-02318-y; Scientific Reports srep27755; MIT News (2022); PMC: PMC10604784; arXiv:2511.04455v1

human-ai_categories.biological: Recurrent connections and top-down modulation (e.g., attention).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs/LSTMs) with loops for sequence processing.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both enable context-dependent processing and memory retention.

human-ai_categories.biological: Dendrites perform local computations and integration.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Dendritic-inspired ANNs add sub-computations for precision and efficiency.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Local processing enhances robustness and parameter efficiency.

human-ai_categories.biological: Discrete action potentials (spikes) for efficient signaling.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) use discrete events for energy-efficient computation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Event-based processing reduces continuous computation overhead.

human-ai_categories.biological: Ultralow energy per spike (e.g., 10^-17 J).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Neuromorphic chips (e.g., IBM TrueNorth) mimic low-power asynchronous events.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both prioritize sparse, event-driven computation over constant activity.
human-ai_categories.sources: IBM Research (2024); Nature Communications s41467-019-12521-x; arXiv:2511.04455v1

human-ai_categories.biological: Chemicals (e.g., dopamine) modulate neuron excitability.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Hyperparameters or adaptive learning rates modulate training dynamics.
human-ai_categories.similarity: External signals tune responsiveness and learning speed.
human-ai_categories.sources: PMC: PMC12480988; Wiley Adv Funct Mater (2023)

human-ai_categories.biological: Short-term (hippocampus) and long-term (cortex) via synaptic changes.
human-ai_categories.artificial: LSTM gates for short-term, embeddings for long-term patterns.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Mechanisms for retaining and consolidating information over time.

human-ai_categories.biological: Brain predicts sensory input and minimizes prediction error.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Autoencoders or generative models minimize reconstruction loss.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both optimize by reducing discrepancy between prediction and reality.

human-ai_categories.biological: Selective focus via neural circuits (e.g., prefrontal cortex directing resources).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Attention layers (e.g., transformers) weighting important inputs.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Prioritization of relevant information amid noise.
human-ai_categories.sources: Nature s41562-025-02318-y; arXiv:1805.10734; ResearchGate (2021); Medium (Anshuman Mahapatra, 2024)

human-ai_categories.biological: Balances new learning with memory retention (e.g., synaptic scaling).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Elastic Weight Consolidation prevents catastrophic forgetting.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Mechanisms to adapt without overwriting prior knowledge.

human-ai_categories.biological: Oscillatory patterns in neural circuits (e.g., theta waves).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Recurrent loops in RNNs for temporal dependencies.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Handles sequences and timing through cycles.

human-ai_categories.biological: Intrinsic excitability modulated by ion channels.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Bias terms in neurons shift activation thresholds.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Adjusts baseline sensitivity without input changes.

human-ai_categories.biological: Evolutionary and experiential fine-tuning.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) over data.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Iterative adjustment to minimize errors or maximize fitness.

human-ai_categories.biological: Neurons activate sparsely for efficient representation (e.g., in visual cortex).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Sparse autoencoders or L1 regularization promoting sparse activations.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Efficient encoding by activating only necessary units.
human-ai_categories.sources: Scientific Reports srep27755; PMC: PMC10604784; Nature Communications (2019); Human Brain Project (2024)

human-ai_categories.biological: Brain regions specialized for functions (e.g., visual cortex, motor areas) with interconnections.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Modular neural networks with sub-networks for specific tasks, integrated via ensembles.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Division into specialized modules allows scalability and fault tolerance.
human-ai_categories.sources: Nature s41598-021-84813-6; arXiv:2306.04449; Lifeboat Foundation; EPJ B (2024)

human-ai_categories.biological: Neural redundancy and synaptic repair mechanisms.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Error-correcting codes or dropout for fault tolerance in ANNs.

human-ai_categories.sources: PLoS Comput Biol e1003330; arXiv:2306.04449; Wikipedia (Artificial neuron); PMC: PMC11850306

human-ai_categories.biological: Brain applies learned skills to new contexts (e.g., analogy-making), with higher transfer for similar tasks but increased interference.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Pre-trained models fine-tuned on new tasks, reusing representations for similar tasks leading to better transfer but overwriting risks.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Reuse of prior knowledge accelerates adaptation to novel scenarios, with trade-offs in interference for task similarity.
human-ai_categories.sources: Nature s41562-025-02318-y; arXiv:2306.04449; Fast Data Science (2025)

human-ai_categories.biological: Mental simulation and dreaming.
human-ai_categories.artificial: GANs or VAEs generating new data.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Creates internal representations or samples.

human-ai_categories.biological: Integration over time in sensory processing.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Convolution over time in video models.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Accumulates evidence across sequences.

human-ai_categories.biological: GABAergic neurons suppress activity, contributing to larger shared neural dynamics in social interactions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Negative weights or inhibition layers, with roles in synchronizing dynamics during simulated interactions.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Balances excitation to prevent overload and facilitates synchronized patterns in social contexts.

human-ai_categories.biological: Analog, parallel brain computation.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Neuromorphic chips (e.g., Loihi) with analog elements.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Hardware emulation for brain-like efficiency.

human-ai_categories.biological: Self-organization in development.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Autoencoders learning features without labels.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Discovers patterns from raw data.

human-ai_categories.biological: Dopamine-driven reinforcement.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Reinforcement Learning with rewards.

human-ai_categories.biological: Billions of synapses for flexibility.

human-ai_categories.biological: Consciousness from neural interactions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Emergent capabilities in large models (e.g., in-context learning).

human-ai_categories.biological: Brain size correlates with intelligence across species.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Performance scales with model size and data.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Larger systems yield better capabilities.

human-ai_categories.biological: Robust to synaptic noise and cell death.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Robust to dropout or perturbations.

human-ai_categories.biological: Context-modulated neural responses.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Embeddings capture contextual meanings.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Represents information relative to surroundings.

human-ai_categories.biological: Dense, small-world network of neural connections with hubs and clusters.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Network architectures with graph-based topologies or attention layers mimicking connectivity.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Efficient information routing via clustered, hub-based structures.

human-ai_categories.biological: Glial cells (e.g., astrocytes) modulate neuron activity and maintain homeostasis.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Auxiliary layers or regularization mechanisms supporting core network stability.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Non-computational elements enhance overall system resilience.
human-ai_categories.sources: arXiv:2306.04449; Nature Communications s41467-019-12521-x; PMC: PMC7612527

human-ai_categories.biological: Generation of new neurons in areas like hippocampus for learning.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Dynamic architectures adding neurons/layers during training (e.g., progressive growing GANs).
human-ai_categories.similarity: Adaptive growth of network capacity in response to new data.

human-ai_categories.biological: Distributed processing across brain hemispheres and regions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Parallel computation in GPUs or distributed ANN training.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Simultaneous handling of multiple inputs for speed and efficiency.

human-ai_categories.biological: Mirror neurons fire when observing actions, enabling learning by imitation.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Behavioral cloning or demonstration-based RL in ANNs.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Learning through observation and replication of behaviors.

human-ai_categories.biological: Multiple brain pathways integrate for decision-making (e.g., voting-like consensus).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Ensemble methods combining multiple ANNs for robust predictions.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Aggregation of diverse subprocesses improves accuracy and reliability.

human-ai_categories.biological: Immune-like responses to perturbations (e.g., neural pruning of noisy signals).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Adversarial training to resist input attacks.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Building resilience against distortions or threats.

human-ai_categories.biological: Sleep consolidates memories via replay and pruning.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Offline training phases or experience replay in RL.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Background optimization without real-time input.

human-ai_categories.biological: Neural synchrony during social exchanges (e.g., empathy circuits), with shared patterns driving causal interactions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Multi-agent RL or graph networks simulating interactions, where disrupting shared components reduces social behaviors.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Emergent patterns in group dynamics and coordination, with synchronized neural activity causally enabling social behaviors.

human-ai_categories.biological: Apoptosis removes dysfunctional neurons.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Pruning dead weights or handling neuron saturation in ANNs.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Elimination of non-contributing elements for efficiency.

human-ai_categories.biological: Brain's adaptive learning via neuromodulators.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Optimizers like Adam mimicking momentum and adaptation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Momentum-based adjustments for faster convergence.

human-ai_categories.biological: Chaotic neural activity enabling flexibility.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Chaotic RNNs for diverse sequence generation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Controlled chaos for exploration and creativity.

human-ai_categories.biological: Grid cells in entorhinal cortex for spatial mapping.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Grid-like representations in trained ANNs (with constraints).
human-ai_categories.similarity: Lattice-based encoding for navigation and positioning.

human-ai_categories.biological: Distributed representations across cortex.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Learned embeddings capturing abstract concepts.

human-ai_categories.biological: Multisensory fusion in superior colliculus.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Multimodal ANNs integrating vision, audio, etc.

human-ai_categories.biological: Amygdala influences decision-making via emotions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Affective computing or sentiment layers in ANNs.

human-ai_categories.biological: Global workspace theory for integrated awareness.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Integrated information in transformer-like models.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Emergence of unified processing from distributed components (controversial, but mechanistic).

human-ai_categories.biological: Neural mechanisms for forming symbols and concepts (e.g., semantic networks).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Brain-constrained networks modeling symbol and concept formation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: In silico formation of abstract representations from sensory data.

human-ai_categories.biological: Evolutionary adaptations in neural structures for efficiency.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Convergent evolution in AI designs mimicking brain efficiencies.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Parallels in development despite different substrates, informing hybrid systems.

human-ai_categories.biological: Constraints like neuron models, synaptic plasticity, and connectivity patterns.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Incorporating biological constraints into ANN models for cognitive function simulation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Enhances realism and performance in modeling brain-like behaviors.

human-ai_categories.biological: Homeostasis maintains intracellular calcium at low levels to avoid cytotoxicity, regulating plasticity.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Calcium levels (c_t) in models decay to baseline, reducing excessive activity for health monitoring.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both regulate calcium to maintain stability and optimal function, using it as a health sensor.

human-ai_categories.biological: Activity-dependent synaptic scaling, reinforcement, and pruning restore damaged neurons.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Triggers repair (scaling, reinforcement, pruning) when health falls below threshold.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both proactively repair degradation to restore functionality and prevent overload.

human-ai_categories.biological: Retroactive interference overwrites prior knowledge, higher with task similarity.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Catastrophic interference in similar tasks due to subspace overwriting.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Shared trade-off: similarity boosts transfer but increases forgetting via representation overlap.

human-ai_categories.biological: PV, SOM, VIP interneurons gate learning, filter inputs, and enable disinhibition.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Separate excitatory/inhibitory units implementing Dale’s principle for control.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both use inhibition to balance excitation, synchronize, and gate updates.

human-ai_categories.biological: Bursts induce stronger synaptic changes; ternary code (silence, single, burst) for learning.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Burstprop uses bursts for signed error communication with feedback alignment.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Both leverage bursts for temporal credit assignment and effective plasticity.

human-ai_categories.biological: Lower interference for dissimilar tasks by maintaining distinct representations.
human-ai_categories.artificial: New subspaces for dissimilar tasks reduce overwriting and interference.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Separation of representations for dissimilar tasks minimizes forgetting while slowing initial learning.

human-ai_categories.biological: Lumpers generalize via shared rules (high transfer, high interference); splitters individuate (low transfer, low interference).
human-ai_categories.artificial: Rich regime for generalization (high transfer/interference); lazy regime for discrimination (low transfer/interference).
human-ai_categories.similarity: Computational trade-off where shared representations boost generalization but increase interference.

human-ai_categories.biological: Synchronized brain cell activity in shared neural spaces during social interactions.
human-ai_categories.artificial: AI agents develop shared neural dynamics for social behaviors.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Partitioning of neural activity into synchronized patterns between interacting entities.

human-ai_categories.biological: Individual-specific neural patterns in unique subspaces during social exchanges.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Unique neural components in AI alongside shared dynamics in social tasks.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Separation of individual-specific from shared synchronized activity in interactions.

human-ai_categories.biological: Mice develop strategies like approaching, waiting, and mutual interactions for coordination.
human-ai_categories.artificial: AI agents evolve similar waiting and coordination behaviors in cooperative tasks.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Independent development of analogous strategies for achieving shared goals.

human-ai_categories.biological: ACC neurons encode cooperative behaviors and partner information for better performance.
human-ai_categories.artificial: AI networks form functional groups emphasizing partner-related info in cooperation.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Encoding of partner actions and functional grouping enhance cooperative outcomes.

human-ai_categories.biological: Inhibiting ACC activity reduces cooperation, highlighting specialized roles.
human-ai_categories.artificial: Disrupting cooperation-related neurons impairs AI performance.
human-ai_categories.similarity: Specialized neural mechanisms are causal for successful coordination, with disruption causing failure.
